summary: This document is a Bureau of Prisons count sheet and inmate roster from the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York (MCC New York) dated August 10, 2019. It records official inmate counts by housing unit and lists specific inmates, including one on suicide watch. The document is significant as it provides administrative records from the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held prior to his death.

persons.name: Bullock
persons.context: Listed as an inmate in the MCC New York roster with registration number 86409-054, assigned to housing unit E05, and noted as being on suicide watch or unassigned.

persons.name: Santana
persons.context: Listed as an inmate in the MCC New York roster with registration number 48816-066, assigned to housing unit K09, and noted as being on suicide watch.

persons.name: Walker
persons.context: Listed as an inmate in the MCC New York roster with registration number 86900-054, assigned to housing unit E06, and noted as being on suicide watch or unassigned.

persons.name: Woolaston
persons.context: Listed as an inmate in the MCC New York roster with registration number 85369-054, assigned to housing unit K11, and noted as being on suicide watch or assigned to food service warehouse.

events.title: Daily Inmate Count at MCC New York
events.description: Routine official inmate count conducted at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, recording a total census of 758 inmates across various housing units.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The document is dated August 10, 2019, which is the day after Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York.
It records an official inmate count showing 758 total inmates housed at the facility across multiple units (B-A, C-A, E-N, E-S, G-N, G-S, H-A, I-N, K-N, K-S, R-A, Z-A, Z-B).
An inmate roster lists four specific inmates (Bullock, Santana, Walker, Woolaston) with notes indicating they were on suicide watch or suicide observation.
The document is a standard Bureau of Prisons administrative form (Count Sheet and Inmate Roster) used for tracking inmate population and assignments.
The presence of inmates on suicide watch is noted in the roster, highlighting suicide prevention protocols at the facility around the time of Epstein's death.
